name: linux-filesystem
description: Enhanced filesystem access for Linux with support for symlinks, permissions, and Linux-specific features
long_description: A comprehensive MCP server providing secure filesystem operations on Linux with advanced features including symbolic link management, permission control via chmod, detailed file information (UID/GID, permissions), and directory access controls. Optimized specifically for Linux environments.

tools.name: read_file
tools.description: Read the complete contents of a file from the filesystem

tools.name: write_file
tools.description: Write content to a file, creating it if it doesn't exist

tools.name: create_directory
tools.description: Create a new directory or ensure a directory exists

tools.name: list_directory
tools.description: List all files and directories in a specified path

tools.name: move_file
tools.description: Move or rename files and directories

tools.name: delete_file
tools.description: Delete a file or empty directory

tools.name: get_file_info
tools.description: Get detailed information about a file or directory including permissions and ownership

tools.name: search_files
tools.description: Search for files matching a pattern in a directory

tools.name: read_symlink
tools.description: Read the target of a symbolic link (Linux-specific)

allowed_directories.title: Allowed Directories
allowed_directories.description: Directories the server can access. The server will have read/write access to all files and subdirectories within these paths.
